job.title: Sr. Site Reliability Engineer
job.description:
As a SRE you are a bridge between development and operations by applying a software engineering mindset to infrastructure services.&nbsp;The SRE is focused on the overall reliability and availability of the enterprise cloud and must understand complex enterprise networks, their dependencies, design, and build.&nbsp;The SRE will identify and reduce manual processes and apply industry incident management, change management, and DevOps concepts.&nbsp;You will be part of a small family and have huge impact on their opportunities for growth.   Job Responsibilities:  - Maintain service stability and reliability by working with internal teams and external vendor partners   
  - Have a complete understanding of operational tools and concepts, such as alerting, monitoring, logging, and health checks   
  - Work with and lead other team members by staying informed of industry innovation, knowledge transfer, and develop team members   
  - Identify opportunities for system improvement and process improvement and partner vendors   
  - Design, plan, build, and implement monitoring tools that promote visibility, transparency, and early detection in a complex technical environment   
  - Ability to handle multiple priorities and troubleshoot complex issues quickly and successfully   
  - Partner with ITSM Sr. Manager on post-incident reviews by putting actions into place to prevent recurring incidents   
  - Be a technology evangelist for the organization   
  - Participate in on-call rotation for level 3 support escalations   
   Required Qualifications:  - 2-3 years of experience on any cloud platform   
  - Hands on experience of writing code in C#, .net or Java, Heavy SQL, SSRS   
  - Solid understanding and experience in data structures, algorithms, and software design   
  - Experience with virtual VPN connectivity, network ports, and firewalls   
  - Experience in troubleshooting relational databases and distributed platforms   
  - Highly skilled in identifying performance bottlenecks, identifying abnormal system behavior, and resolving root cause of service issues   
  - Experience in Incident Management and ITIL Service Operations   
  - Must be able to work in a collaborative cross-functional team environment   
  - Strong interpersonal skills   
  - Understanding of the CI/CD lifecycle   
  - Working knowledge of source control systems such as git   
   Preferred Qualifications:  - AWS Certification as Cloud Practitioner, Architect Associate, Developer Associate   
  - Experience working with globally distributed teams   
  - Enjoys mentoring and guiding teammates   
  - Experience working with healthcare technologies   
  - ITIL Foundations certification   
   We are looking for someone who is local to the Lynchburg, VA metro ideally and may consider remote candidates.
